segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is so unstable, and he’s leaning way too far.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the girl standing below him, waiting for her share with such excitement.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They’re both so focused on those cookies that they don’t even see the water all over the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman drying dishes has no idea what’s going on behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is getting deeper, and she’s just standing there, lost in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the boy will fall before the woman even realizes what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm, but inside, it’s like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how careless everyone is being right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s hand is outstretched, and she looks so hopeful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to get those cookies, no matter the risk.
segments.speaker: PAR
